instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
Hello again everyone,

Due to your helps and previous posts I have repaired 2 macbooks, and definitely appreciate that Im here with you.

Here is the new story;

A customer of mine brought me a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> coffe with milk spilled on it (white and milk without lactose, he said :D :D :D )) and it does not boot up. First I took the board out cleaned the whole board. Changed the components on the corrosion parts. But now on my ampmeter when I plug it I get on 5.192V 0.00A from all Type-C ports.

And I cant see any heating part under the thermal camera also.

any idea where should I start to look? Watched too many videos and read posts but couldn't get any idea. And it is my first time working ona T2 chip macbook.

Thank you for your all help already.

Kind regards

Emre

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message: What about <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> around 0,017V on RB641
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>  around 0.034V on CB400

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground on both lines also.
Do you get 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground for both lines
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.004
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> 0.407

Yes there is 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>

I have checked also <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line and there is a short but whn I give 12.2V there cant see any heating part on thermal camera. I really cant understand.

When I plugged my ampmeter to my ipower max and adjust the power supply to 20V and 5amp then I find out that UB400 and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> gets warm. But cant see anything else which is short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line :(

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
"I give 12.2V there"
The board may be trash now.
How many threads we have on the forum about this error...

Check if you get similar resistance to ground on any coil; start with CPU coils.
BTW, use ohm scale this time.

threads.message:

[URL]https://www.veed.io/view/25757746-5638-4353-9ec5-8c13c7dc6e6f?sharingWidget=true[/URL]

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message: Now check the exact resistance between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and L7210.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
I put one side to L7210 1st pad which is <SIGNAL>CPUCORE_SW1</SIGNAL> and other side of my multimeter to F7000 second pad which belongs to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line and read on the same mode of my multimeter (resistance Ohm mode) and got 0.003 ohm
and on buzzer mode of multimeter I get signal when  I put the multimeter arms to these two components

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
Forget the buzzer, when test low resistance values.
It beeps until 0-50-075, depending by model.

Now, if the resulting resistance between two points is the difference of their resistance to ground, guess what?
The problem is on the common component, connected to both points.
If the resulting resistance between two points is the sum of their resistance to ground, the problem is on other component; connected to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and ground (possibly a filter capacitor), in this case.

In any case, don't forget to check all coils in this manner...

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message: Okay I got the idea but while Im trying to understand this idea :) Im a bit confused about the easiest way to find for example that filter capacitor. Because I cant see anything on thermal camera so which is the easiest way to find it my friend?

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
Did you apply power again?
Are you sure is not case explained above?

Using different manner for posting your readings, doesn't help.
I'm pretty sure, you can't read 0.003 anywhere; that means 3 miliohm!
But if you really get miliom value between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and L7210, doesn't mean that is short?
You've reported 2.4 ohm and 2.3 ohm to ground respectively.
The difference is 0.1 ohm; one of <CHIP>U7210</CHIP>/20 is burnt...

I considered <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> schematic.
Next time, remember to post board model in the title of new thread.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message: Okay thank you for you help. Just ordered the <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> so will let you know about the result. Thank you for your help.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
You must lift L7210 one side and check if short dissapears from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
If still short, then do the same for L7220.
You must find which of <CHIP>U7210</CHIP>/20 is burnt...

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message: okay will do now

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message: <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> has been removed and short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> gone. Thank you

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
Keep in mind, you've already injected 12V into CPU!
Possibly no repair on this board.
Nothing to lose however; give it a try with new chip.
And don't do same error next time...

Thank you for your all help. Now the computer boots. But there are other issues I found out,

1) It does have no display/image and backlight.
2) No external display too.
3) No chime.
4) I can hear the charging sound when I plug in the cable.
5) I dont know if it comes up before log in (can't remember how it works normally), if it does then no touchbar.

Anything else you want me measure for you? Or anything you advice me to do? Like SMC reset? By the way which is the right SMC reset for this mainboard? Because all websites are saying different things for SMC reset.

Thank you

Emre

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
I have checked 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S_ALSCAM_F</SIGNAL> 5v 

and I read the same ones on lcd connecter flex too. And these are internal lcd connected measured values

threads.title: Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stucks at 5v. 0.00amp No Boot After Water Damage
threads.message:
Can you confirm USB activity?
Test external video disconnecting internal LCD.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://support.smartsourcedit.com/hc/en-us/articles/360037083553-How-to-Reset-SMC-on-MacBook-Air-MacBook-Pro-2018-or-later-with-T2-Security-Chip[/URL]
This link was already posted on the forum; not early than last week.
Don't you plan to read more threads on the forum and take notes?
However, I don't think SMC reset helps in this case.
